info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lawrence, southwestern Crawford, southeastern Jasper and northeastern Richland Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 311 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ste. Marie, or 9 miles southeast of Newton, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Willow Hill around 320 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oblong and Hardinville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Illinois.
